intro: Anisogonium heterophlebium, commonly known as the variable-veined fern, is a unique species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, irregularly branched fronds with varying vein patterns, which contribute to its common name. The plant exhibits a creeping rhizome system, allowing it to spread and colonize moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually leathery and have a deep green color, often with a slightly serrated margin. This fern is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid and well-drained soil conditions.
